coredata.dc:title: Hidden Node Optimization for Extreme Learning Machine
coredata.prism:copyright: Copyright © 2012 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
coredata.prism:publisher: The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
coredata.prism:issueName: Conference on Modelling, Identification and Control
coredata.dc:creator: Huang, Yan-wei
Lai, Da-hu
coredata.dc:description: AbstractThe number of hidden nodes is a critical factor for the generalization of ELM. Generally, it is heavy for time consumption to obtain the optimal number of hidden nodes with trial-and-error. A novel algorithm is proposed to optimize the hidden node number to guarantee good generalization, which employs the PSO in the optimization process with structural risk minimization principle. The simulation results indicate our algorithm for the optimal number of hidden nodes is reasonable and feasible with 6 datasets on benchmark problems by the accuracy comparisons.
coredata.dcterms:subject: ELM
VC confidence
structural risk
hidden nodes
PSO

ce:article-footnote.ce:note-para: Selection and/or peer review under responsibility of American Applied Science Research Institute.

head.ce:title: Hidden Node Optimization for Extreme Learning Machine

ce:affiliation.ce:textfn: College of Electrical Engineering & Automation, Fuzhou University, Fuzhou, Fujian, China

ce:abstract-sec.ce:simple-para: The number of hidden nodes is a critical factor for the generalization of ELM. Generally, it is heavy for time consumption to obtain the optimal number of hidden nodes with trial-and-error. A novel algorithm is proposed to optimize the hidden node number to guarantee good generalization, which employs the PSO in the optimization process with structural risk minimization principle. The simulation results indicate our algorithm for the optimal number of hidden nodes is reasonable and feasible with 6 datasets on benchmark problems by the accuracy comparisons.

sb:title.sb:maintitle: Extreme learning machine: a new learning scheme of feedforward neural networks
